SEARCH
Module brickGame
Package com.brickbreakergame.managers

Class AnimationManager

java.lang.Object
com.brickbreakergame.managers.AnimationManager
public class AnimationManager extends Object
This class manages various animations within a Brick Breaker game application. It includes methods for transitioning between scenes, animating UI elements, and applying visual effects.

  • Constructor Details

    • AnimationManager

      public AnimationManager()

  • Method Details

    • startTransition

      public void startTransition(javafx.stage.Stage stage, Runnable afterTransition)
      Initiates a sliding transition animation for scene switching. The current scene slides out to the left, and then the new scene slides in from the right. A specified action is executed after the transition completes.
      Parameters:
      stage - The stage on which the transition animation is to be performed. It should not be null and should contain a valid scene.
      afterTransition - A Runnable that encapsulates the actions to be performed after the transition animation completes. It is executed once the incoming scene has finished sliding into view.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the stage or its scene or root node is null.

    • fadeInMenu

      public void fadeInMenu(javafx.scene.layout.VBox layout)
      Applies a fade-in effect to a VBox layout. The opacity of the layout gradually increases from a lower value to full opacity.
      Parameters:
      layout - The VBox layout to be faded in. The effect makes the layout transition from semi-transparent to fully opaque.

    • fadeOutMenu

      public void fadeOutMenu(javafx.scene.layout.VBox layout, javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Applies a fade-out effect to a VBox layout and closes the associated stage. The layout's opacity transitions from full opacity to fully transparent, after which the stage is closed.
      Parameters:
      layout - The VBox layout to be faded out.
      stage - The Stage to be closed after the fade-out effect completes.

    • fadeOutPartially

      public void fadeOutPartially(javafx.scene.layout.VBox layout, double toValue)
      Applies a partial fade-out effect to a VBox layout. The opacity of the layout transitions to a specified lower value.
      Parameters:
      layout - The VBox layout to be partially faded out.
      toValue - The target opacity value. Must be between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the toValue is not within the range of 0.0 to 1.0.

    • animateHeartLoss

      public void animateHeartLoss(javafx.scene.control.Label heartLabel)
      Animates a label to indicate the loss of a heart in the game. The label's text color alternates between red and white to create a flashing effect.
      Parameters:
      heartLabel - The Label representing the heart count. Its text color is animated to indicate the loss.

    • animateHeartIncrease

      public void animateHeartIncrease(javafx.scene.control.Label heartLabel)
      Animates a label to indicate the gain of a heart in the game. The label's text color alternates between green and white to create a flashing effect.
      Parameters:
      heartLabel - The Label representing the heart count. Its text color is animated to indicate the gain.

    • coolButtonAnimation

      public void coolButtonAnimation(javafx.scene.control.Button button, Runnable afterAnimation)
      Creates an animation for a button that makes it shrink and fade out. The button first scales down and then fades out completely. An action is executed after the animation completes.
      Parameters:
      button - The Button to be animated with the shrinking and fading effect.
      afterAnimation - A Runnable that is executed after the animation completes. It can contain any subsequent actions.

    • initializeBlur

      public void initializeBlur(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Applies a Gaussian blur effect to the entire stage, creating a blur overlay. This is typically used to create a visual distinction between different UI layers.
      Parameters:
      stage - The Stage on which the blur effect is to be applied.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the stage or its scene is null.

    • shrinkAndFadeOutBonus

      public static void shrinkAndFadeOutBonus(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rectangle)
      Animates a rectangle representing a bonus item by shrinking and fading it out. The rectangle scales down to nothing and fades out to full transparency, then becomes invisible.
      Parameters:
      rectangle - The Rectangle representing a bonus item in the game. It is animated and then made invisible.
